'''Charles Edward Bradley''' (November 5, 1948 â€“ September 23, 2017) was an American [[funk]] and [[soul music|soul]] singer.  After years of obscurity and a part-time music career, Bradley came to prominence in his early 50s. His performances and recording style were consistent with the revivalist approach of his main label [[Daptone Records]], celebrating the feel of funk and soul from the 1960s and 1970s.  One review said he "echoes the evocative delivery of [[Otis Redding]]".

Called "The Screaming Eagle of Soul," Bradley was the subject of the documentary ''Soul of America'' which premiered at [[South by Southwest]] in 2012. He died in 2017 following a long illness.
